title: Đề thi giữa kì 1 Tiếng Anh 11 - Global Success - Đề số 1

theory.brief: Đề thi giữa học kì 1 kiểm tra toàn diện các kỹ năng: Ngữ âm (phát âm và trọng âm), Ngữ pháp và từ vựng (thì hiện tại hoàn thành, hiện tại tiếp diễn, từ đồng nghĩa, trái nghĩa, từ loại), Đọc hiểu, và Viết câu (chuyển đổi câu đồng nghĩa).
examples: Present Perfect: The government has proposed changes recently.
Present Continuous: He is tasting something now.

exercises.question: Find the word which has a different sound in the part underlined (ch): child / choose / charm / school
exercises.explanation: 'school' has /k/ sound in 'ch', others have /tʃ/ sound

exercises.question: Find the word which has a different sound in the part underlined (c): cookbook / closing / muscle / clothing
exercises.explanation: In 'muscle', the 'c' is silent (/mʌsəl/), while others have /k/ sound in 'c'
hints: The 'c' letter can be silent in some words

exercises.question: Find the word which has a different sound in the part underlined (s ending): volumes / takes / laughs / develops
exercises.explanation: 'volumes' ends with /z/ sound, others end with /s/ sound

exercises.question: Choose the word which has a different stress pattern: aquatic / respectful / extended / impolite
exercises.explanation: 'impolite' has stress on 3rd syllable, others on 2nd
hints: Count the syllables and find the stressed one

exercises.question: Choose the word which has a different stress pattern: release / avoid / global / event
exercises.explanation: 'global' has stress on 1st syllable, others on 2nd
hints: Count the syllables and find the stressed one

exercises.question: The government ______ changes to the voting system recently.
exercises.explanation: Recently signals Present Perfect tense

exercises.question: His face looks funny. He ______ something in the kitchen now.
exercises.explanation: 'Now' signals Present Continuous, 'taste' as action verb can use -ing

exercises.question: She is the person who ______ me since I was a child.
exercises.explanation: 'Since + past time' signals Present Perfect
hints: Look for 'since I was a child'

exercises.question: Australia ______ ASEAN's first Dialogue Partner in 1974 and since then the country ______ with the organisation in a wide socio-economic range.
exercises.explanation: 'In 1974' = Past Simple, 'since then' = Present Perfect
hints: First action in 1974 (past), second action continues from then

exercises.question: The proposal ______ to support the government's effort to reduce energy use in public buildings.
exercises.explanation: 'Seem' is a linking verb, not used in continuous tense

exercises.question: Mark the word(s) CLOSEST in meaning: Old people have an active lifestyle and are cared for by their families.
exercises.explanation: active = energetic (năng động)

exercises.question: Mark the word(s) CLOSEST in meaning: You will be unhealthy if you eat too many snacks.
exercises.explanation: unhealthy = sick (không khỏe mạnh)

exercises.question: Mark the word(s) OPPOSITE in meaning: Spending more time outdoors can boost the body's strength and ability to function well.
exercises.explanation: strength (sức mạnh) >< weakness (sự yếu đuối)

exercises.question: Mark the word(s) OPPOSITE in meaning: Getting enough sleep can reduce stress and improve your mood.
exercises.explanation: reduce (giảm) >< increase (tăng)

exercises.passage:
Everyone knows that exercise is good for the body and the mind. We all want to keep fit and look good, but too many of us take up the wrong sport and quickly lose interest. So now fitness experts are advising people to choose an activity that matches their character.

For instance, those who like to be with other people often enjoy golf or squash, or playing for a basketball, football, or hockey team. However, you may prefer to go jogging or swimming if you're happier on your own.

Do you like competition? Then try something like running, or a racket sport such as tennis. If, on the other hand, winning isn't important to you, then activities like dancing can be an enjoyable challenge without the need to show you're better than everyone else.

Finally, think about whether you find it easy to make yourself do exercise. If so, sports like weight training at home and cycling are fine. If not, book a skiing holiday, Taekwondo lessons, or a tennis court. You're much more likely to do something you've already paid for!

exercises.explanation: 'take up' means to start a new activity or hobby

exercises.passage:
The family dynamic evolves as a teen matures and can test the parent-teen relationship. With both sides feeling mixed emotions, this time can be challenging.

Puberty brings lots of emotions for teens and is a time of readjustment for the whole family. Parents have a huge influence on a young child's values and interests, and so it can often feel hard for them to separate from their teen, who wants to develop their own identity and to have new freedoms. This may lead to conflict, as both parents and teens need time to figure out how to adapt the relationship.

As teens get older, it is important for them to take on responsibilities. This highlights the valuable contribution each family member makes to a home and teaches teens about what it's like to be an adult. Setting clear rules about routine and home life helps teens to know what's expected of them - even if they do complain or resist. Expectations go both ways, however, and so constant communication and flexibility, when necessary, will help avoid conflict.

It is important for parents and teens to overcome life's many distractions in order to spend quality time together. For parents, maintaining a close relationship with a teen who is preprogrammed to separate from them can be tricky, but it helps to be present and willing. Talking about the things that are going well is as helpful as discussing areas of conflict.
exercises.question: What is the main idea of the passage about family dynamics?
exercises.explanation: The passage focuses on parent-teen relationship challenges
hints: Look at the overall topic of the passage
